proposition: The myth of the 'Post-It Fallacy' has been debunked.
The 'Post-It Fallacy' was considered a tool for goal setting and pursuing objectives.
The common belief is that by writing down a goal on a Post-It note and placing it in a visible location, it will increase the likelihood of achieving that goal.
This belief has been proven to be ineffective.
The misconception stems from the fact that our visual system is wired to adapt to regular stimuli in our environment.
The visual system adapts to regular stimuli whether it is in a limited or cluttered space.
Anything that is consistently seen in our visual field tends to get disregarded over time.
Our brain cancels out familiar visual cues over time.
